basics.name: Agnes Poks
basics.label: Mechanical and Electrical Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced engineer with a background in control systems, electric drives, and vehicle dynamics. Proven track record in R&D, project assistance, and teaching.

work.name: TU Wien
work.summary: Research in motorcycle safety and trajectory estimation for off-road vehicles.
highlights: Motorcycle Safety - Friction potential estimation (with KTM and PIERER)

work.name: TU Wien
work.summary: Worked on multiple research projects related to vehicle control and modeling.
highlights: Distributed MPC for cooling units in trucks (DiNaMiC)
Model-based control of electric refrigerated transporters (CONSERVE)
Simulation of fuel cell systems for virtual sensors (KEYTECH4EV)

work.name: ZIEHL-ABEGG SE
work.summary: R&D of electric drive controls and embedded systems.
highlights: Embedded software in C/C++ for diverse processor architectures

work.name: ZIEHL-ABEGG SE
work.summary: Designed automatic pulse magnetization device for EC rotors.

work.name: ZIEHL-ABEGG SE
work.summary: Worked on simulation, microcontroller programming, and software testing.

education.summary: Doctor of Technical Sciences with a focus on vehicle system dynamics. Advisor: Prof. Dr.techn. Martin Kozek
Thesis on winding admittances in PMSMs. Advisor: Prof. Dr.-Ing. Serge Zacher
Thesis on sensorless control of asynchronous machines. Advisor: Prof. Dr.-Ing. Jürgen Ulm
